name: MECH 280 Introduction to Fluid Mechanics
prerequisites: All of MATH 152, PHYS 170 and one of MATH 217, MATH 253 and either (a) all of PHYS 101, PHYS 102 or (b) PHYS 153.

description: Major physiological mechanisms that define eukaryotic cells, explored through student visits to UBC research laboratories and discussion of recent scientific literature, with emphasis on the techniques and strategies that enable researchers to test hypotheses and advance new concepts.
name: BIOL 432 Research Strategies and Techniques in Cell Biology
prerequisites: All of BIOL 200, BIOL 362 and one of BIOL 233, BIOL 234. (And fourth-year standing.)

description: Selected topics focusing upon various issues arising in international economic relations. Open only to fourth-year students in the Major program in International Relations.
name: ECON 457 Seminar in International Economic Relations

description: Teams comprising students in APSC 486 and COMM 486 create a business plan and a prototype or engineering solution of a novel product, process, or process component.
name: APSC 486 New Venture Design

description: Study and practice of law journal editing and business operations. For students acting as senior editors or the business manager for the UBC Law Review, the Canadian Journal of Family Law or any other equivalent legal journal based in the Faculty of Law.
name: LAW 486 Law Review Credit
LARC 582B Seminar: Special Topics - ADV TPCS IN SUST

description: Use of industrial engineering concepts and methods to analyze and improve organizations, including operations strategy and competitiveness, quality control, work measurement, inventory management, linear programming, sensitivity analysis, transportation problems, and capacity planning.
name: WOOD 330 Industrial Engineering
